definition: to fix/to settle/a libation to the dead
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: It is thought to be a cornerstone of free speech on the Web.
sentences.chinese: 这被视为是网络言论自由的奠基石。

sentences.english: But it might be a ground-up launching pad for the newspapers of tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 但是，它会是未来报业的奠基石。

sentences.english: Self-confidence is one of the cornerstones of success.
sentences.chinese: 自信是成功的奠基石之一。

sentences.english: The canvas Yin Xiang Ri Chu is the cornerstone of impressionistic paintings.
sentences.chinese: 《印象日出》这幅油画，是印象派绘画的奠基石。

sentences.english: This is one of the cornerstone messages of the environmental movement .
sentences.chinese: 这些行为是保护环境运动的奠基石之一。

sentences.english: In 1793, President Washington laid the cornerstone of the US Capitol.
sentences.chinese: 1793年，华盛顿总统给美国国会大厦植奠基石。

definition: large inscribed stele/fig. great achievement/imperishable masterpiece
towering buildings are built up from the ground (idiom)/great oaks from little acorns grow
pinyin: wan4 zhang4 gao1 lou2 ping2 di4 qi3

definition: lit. contribute bricks and tiles for a building (idiom)/fig. to do one's bit to help
to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
lit. a brick as a door knocker (idiom); fig. a temporary expedient/to use sb as a stepping stone to fortune
the road one must follow or take/the only way
a project of vital and lasting importance
